author: Trefor Moss
title: China Auto Exec on Self-Driving Cars: ‘You Can’t Just Put Some Sensors on Top’ - WSJ
text:
BEIJING—China has made self-driving auto technology a national priority, but the recent U.S. fatality involving an autonomous test car is prompting calls for the Chinese government to slow down those efforts to ensure public safety.
China now has 93 pilot projects involving self-driving cars and shared-driving services nationwide, according to KPMG LLP. Some auto industry leaders warn that developers may be moving too quickly to testing on public roads.
...
